Like Scott said before, it's not for making DVD's, but rather for creating hard drive images and transferring them to a medium in archived format. It wouldn't be bootable of course, but you could make a drive image, burn it or save it to a flash drive and then restore it with partimage.
not an issue with that just teach me how to use it

It's a commandline utility, so it must be run from the terminal. Basically, you can choose to create your archive using tar gzip files or bz2 if you want them to be more compressed. To specify where you want an image saved, you have to type in the full Unix path to the archive you want to make. Otherwise, you can just specify a file name, and it will save to the current working directory of the terminal.
